pages.text: Everything in Create utilizes a different unit of power called $(3)su$(), which is short for $(3)stress units$(). Also, some general advice: higher RPM requires more $(3)stress$() to rotate, just like gear ratios IRL. That is why a Large Cogwheel connected to a Cogwheel rotates faster, but requires more $(3)su$() to function when connected to an appliance.
This is what is considered Tier 1 in terms of stress generation. $(br2)Maximum stress output is $(3)256su$() as of Create 0.5.1 and no longer requires water to be flowing in a specific direction.
Can be considered Tier 1.5 in terms of stress generation. $(br2)Maximum stress output is $(3)512su$().

This is what is considered Tier 2 in terms of stress generation. $(br2)It is recommended to craft a large amount of Sails and Sail Frames for functional use. $(br2)Maximum stress output is $(3)8,192su$().

This is what is considered Tier 3 in terms of stress generation. $(br2)A single Steam Engine can output a maximum of $(3)16,384su$(). However, you can have a maximum of 9 Steam Engines together on a Level 9 boiler and output $(3)147,456su$() if connected altogether.

Ensure that your Mechanical Pump is rotating at a fast enough RPM and uses a separate source of stress as making a self-sufficient boiler will only cause additional complexity. $(br2)I recommend using a Windmill Bearing as the source of stress for your Mechanical Pump.
